verses.text: 神施恩及感恩稱頌 （大衛的詩。）耶和華啊！我向你呼求；我的磐石啊！不要不聽我；如果你緘默不理我，我就跟那些下坑的人一樣。（本節在《馬索拉抄本》包括細字標題）

words.note: Used as a proper noun for God in the Bible.
Often implies expressing thanks.
In a biblical context, usually refers to a psalm.
Transliteration of Hebrew tetragrammaton.
Metaphor for strength or refuge, often for God.
The 'pit' is a biblical euphemism for the grave or Sheol.
The authoritative Hebrew text of the Jewish Bible.

verses.text: 我向你呼求，向你的至聖所舉手禱告的時候，求你垂聽我懇求的聲音。

words.note: Refers to the inner sanctuary of the Tabernacle/Temple.
The common verb for prayer in Christianity.
Implies a higher authority listening to a lower one.

verses.text: 求你不要把我和壞人，跟作惡的人一同除掉；他們與鄰居說平安的話，心裡卻存著奸惡。
願你按著他們所作的，照著他們所行的惡報應他們；願你照著他們手所作的報應他們，把他們應得的報應加給他們。

words.note: Forms a nominal phrase like 'that which (verb)'.
Can be an adjective or a noun, here referring to evil deeds.
Often used for divine judgment or consequence.
Used as a noun for the consequence of actions.

verses.text: 他們既然不關心耶和華的作為，和他手所作的，耶和華就必拆毀他們，不建立他們。

words.note: Transliteration of Hebrew tetragrammaton.
Forms a nominal phrase like 'that which (verb)'.
Transliteration of Hebrew tetragrammaton.

verses.text: 耶和華是應當稱頌的，因為他聽了我懇求的聲音。

words.note: Transliteration of the Hebrew divine name.
Often used for praising God.

words.definition: particle, used after adjectives or verbs

words.note: Often refers to earnest prayer.

verses.text: 耶和華是我的力量，是我的盾牌；我的心倚靠他，我就得到幫助；所以我的心歡樂。我要用詩歌頌讚他。

words.note: A common biblical term for faith or dependence on God.
Refers to religious hymns or psalms.
Stronger than 稱頌, often used for worship.

verses.text: 耶和華是他子民的力量，又是他受膏者得救的保障。

words.note: Refers to God's chosen people.
Refers to kings, priests, or the Messiah.

verses.text: 求你拯救你的子民，賜福給你的產業，牧養他們，懷抱他們，直到永遠。

words.note: In biblical contexts, often refers to God's chosen people as His inheritance.
Figuratively, to care for or guide like a shepherd.
Here implies tender care and protection.
